metadata.dc:author: Aicardi, Pedro
Takashima, Lorena
Florio, Dario
Paolini, Virginia
Della Maggiora, Maricel
Baños, Andrea
metadata.dc:description: A 34-year-old man with an 8-year history of outbreaks of oral and genital ulcers presented with high fever and skin lesions that had developed 21 days earlier, without abdominal pain. Computed tomography revealed intestinal perforation requiring surgery. After treatment with corticosteroids and azathioprine proved to be ineffective, it was switched to adalimumab.
metadata.dc:subject: Intestinal complications
Behçet's disease
Complicaciones intestinales
Adalimumab
Enfermedad de Behçet
metadata.dc:title: Enfermedad de Behçet con perforación intestinal: a propósito de un caso.
Behçet's disease with intestinal perforation: A case report.
